newsitem.title: FRANCE: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 13.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - France - Le Monde Sept 13.

text.p: These are leading stories in afternoon daily Le Monde.
-- Justice Minister Jacques Toubon calls for expanded legal recourses to pursue people who promote racism.
His call follows far-right leader Jean-Marie Le Pen's repeated statements that racial inequality was "a fact".
-- 1997 budget to be presented to Parliament on September 18, with a public deficit expected to reach some 278 billion francs. Financial markets may react unfavourably.
-- Banking sector could shed a further 60,000 jobs from now to year 2000. Credit Lyonnais workers demonstrated yesterday against further restructuring plan involving 5,000 job cuts.
-- Debt restructuring talks between Eurotunnel and its bankers in progress, shares rally.
-- French airports expect total safety through cargo controls, by year 2002.
-- Paris bourse to launch new secondary market index on October 1 comprising 140 medium-sized companies.
-- Calls for labour unrest this week in textile, defence sectors and at Credit Lyonnais have not been widely followed.
